newsitem.title: USA: Mercury Finance named in Chicago class suit.
newsitem.headline: Mercury Finance named in Chicago class suit.

text.p: The law firm of Wechsler Harwood Halebian & Feffer LLP said on Thursday it has filed a suit seeking class action status in a federal court in Chicago on behalf of shareholders of Mercury Finance Co.

In a statement, the law firm said the complaint charges Mercury and certain of its senior officers with violations of federal securities laws for allegedly materially overstating Mercury's financial statements and operating results from at least 1993 to 1996.
Mercury, a used-car financing company, was forced to restate its 1996 earnings last week due to alleged accounting irregularities.
The company is currently in talks with lenders regarding financing to meet its liquidity requirements.
Wechsler Harwood said it is seeking to recover damages for buyers of Mercury common stock between February 4, 1994 through January 28, 1997.
The company was not immediately available for comment on the suit.
